intro: Bupleurum laricense, commonly known as the Karakoram sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cold and arid conditions. Its root system is adapted to absorb nutrients from poor soils, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. Bupleurum laricense is often found in mountainous regions at elevations above 3,000 meters.
